title: Hailflow Step-Up Its Game
text:
Technology | 19 October 2015 19:30 CET Hailflow Step-Up Its Game By Michael Amedor 
Hailflow, a subsidiary of SARA Group, says it will approach the Ghanaian market with innovation, technology and good design to meet the changing demand of Ghanaian homes. 
The General Manager, Karim Ghazele, disclosed that the company has expanded its showroom to give an exposure of its latest products which are of high international standard and environmental friendly. 
He said as the company celebrates its fifth anniversary with four branches across the country, it has positioned itself to serve the general public with good products from the Europe, USA, and China among others. 
Haiflow is a distributor of high quality sanitary ware, ceramic tile, bathroom accessories, shower enclosures, bathroom cabinetry and jacuzzis. 
It caters not only to the Ghanaian market, but to the African continent as a whole. Its client base consists of retailers, contractors, developers as well as architects and designers. 
Mr. Ghazele said the products are sourced from reputable manufacturers from around the world with its main product lines being Villeroy & Boch, Grohe, Pavigres, Eliane, Tredex all of whom have well-earned reputations as leaders in their industry. 
Haiflow is the fashion leader when it comes to the latest innovative designs in the industry as it offers to clients a variety of products that cater not only to their individual needs, but also their budgets. 
Mr. Ghazele said the stress of Ghanaians travelling to Europe and other continents to buy products is over as the company has brought these products to the door-steps of Ghanaians and prospective buyers. 
The company has also renovated its showroom on the Spintex road in order to serve its customers better. The General Manager therefore urged customers to come to the newly renovated showroom for their quality products that meet their needs. 
He said they do regular research on the market to know the taste of the Ghanaian consumer so every product in the showroom is designed to address the needs of the consumer. 
“Haiflow is dedicated to maximise the value we offer to each customer every day. The Haiflow team is constantly looking for ways to improve as we are committed to quality,” he added. 
He said the company will in the next five years open additional six branches to the already four existing ones in the country to serve the general public irrespective of where you are. 
Mr Ghazele added that the company will continue to educate the public to know the benefit they will derive in purchasing their products in order not to settle for inferior products.
